p: Coronaviruses, named for their crown-like spikes on their outer surfaces ( Fig. 1), are of the family Coronaviridae in the Nidovirales order. Coronaviruses are enveloped, RNA viruses. Their nucleic material comprises of non-segmented single-strand RNA, sub-grouped into alpha (α), beta (β), gamma (γ), and delta (δ) ( Islam et al., 2020) ranging from 26∼32 kb in length and 80∼160 nm 9 in size. Coronaviruses cause several diseases, including bronchitis, hepatitis, and gastroenteritis, all of which may lead to death in humans, birds, and other animals ( Chafekar and Fielding, 2018).
